description:
We study the theory of programming languages and their implementation.
Topics may include automata, semantics, verification, interpreters,
compilers, and runtime systems. This course includes a substantial project.
title: Programming Language Design and Implementation
prerequisite: YSC2229 Introductory Data Structures and Algorithms (or previously YSC2204 Fundamentals of Programming) or permission of instructor (Significant programming experience, probably in the relevant implementation language. Understanding of basic automata.)
corequisite: YSC3232 Object-oriented Programming (or previously YSC3207 Principles and Tools of Software Development)
